alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 8:13PM PST until January 08 at 5:07AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Deschutes River Near Rainier affecting Thurston County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Deschutes River Near Rainier. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, the Deschutes River will flood downstream in Tumwater Valley including the golf course. Minor flooding will also occur in several residential areas, mainly Cougar Mountain and Driftwood Valley. Many roads and farm lands will also be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM PST Thursday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM PST Thursday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.6 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 01/25/1964. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Friday morning at 715 AM PST.
